Crimes.Violation_Type: Immigration violation due to extended stay beyond authorized period
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant meets the criteria for a stay of removal under IRPA
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant's claims were vague, speculative, and unsupported by evidence; pending applications and personal relationships cited
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Motion dismissed for failure to demonstrate serious question, irreparable harm, or favorable balance of convenience
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Rejected refugee claimant with subsequent failed applications
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Removal order issued after rejection of claims
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Pending applications, family ties in Canada, fear of risk upon return
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Serious question, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Credibility and evidentiary support of claims
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Application for judicial review and stay of removal
Crimes.Review_Standard: Federal Court standard for stay applications
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Pending applications, personal relationships, prior risk assessments
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections related to removal and stay under IRPA
Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian and compassionate considerations, family separation
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Insufficient evidence provided to support irreparable harm
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Three-part test for stay: serious question, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of concrete evidence supporting risk or hardship
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Alleged family separation and inadequate care not proven as irreparable
Crimes.Cause_Description: Refugee claim and H&C application rejected leading to removal order
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Claims evaluated but found insufficiently substantiated
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA provisions on unauthorized stay and removal
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Speculative nature of claims without documentation
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Negative assessment due to lack of proof
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No serious question raised, no irreparable harm shown, public interest favors enforcement
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to provide credible, verifiable evidence
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Serious question, irreparable harm, balance of convenience

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with removal order
Crimes.Violation_Type: Non-compliance with a legally issued removal order
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Eligibility for stay of removal based on claimed special circumstances
Crimes.Application_Facts: Claims of family separation, inadequate care, and safety risks in Peru
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Motion for stay of removal dismissed
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Stay of removal pending further applications
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Denial of stay due to unmet legal criteria
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign national with rejected claims and active removal order
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Enforcement of removal order by authorities
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Family ties, health concerns, perceived danger in country of origin
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Serious question, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Weight of public interest vs. individual hardship
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Request for interim relief during judicial review
Crimes.Review_Standard: Federal Court’s threshold for granting stays
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Affidavits regarding family and health issues
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA provisions on removal enforcement and discretionary deferral
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Deemed inadequate to meet legal burden
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of compelling evidence demonstrating irreparable harm
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Alleged harms not established as irreparable
Crimes.Cause_Description: Seeking delay of removal due to ongoing personal and medical concerns
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Submitted evidence reviewed but found unpersuasive
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA requirements for compliance with removal orders
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Failed to comply with removal directive
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA Sections governing removal and stays
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Unfavorable due to lack of specificity and proof
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No serious issue raised; balance of convenience favors state interest
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Serious question, irreparable harm, balance of convenience

Crimes.Crime_Name: Humanitarian and Compassionate application refusal under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Refusal of humanitarian and compassionate (H&C) application
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Evaluation of family ties, integration, and hardship factors
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate exceptional circumstances
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Consistency and reliability of applicant's submissions
Crimes.Legal_Rule: H&C provisions allow residence permit outside normal categories if justified
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decisions
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Fairness in processing of H&C application
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Family unity, best interests of child, establishment in Canada
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Application denied due to insufficient justification
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Assessment of whether process was fair and transparent
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Length of stay, family composition, employment history
Crimes.Legal_Framework: IRPA sections on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Argued undue hardship and strong community ties
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Government defended decision as reasonable and compliant
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Affidavits, documents showing family and financial situation
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Stay of removal and acceptance of H&C application
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Permanent resident status on H&C grounds
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Administrative review followed by judicial challenge
Crimes.Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Negative – no basis to overturn refusal
Crimes.Pending_Relief_or_Application: Pre-removal risk assessment and H&C application previously denied
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Discretionary power to grant residence on H&C grounds

Crimes.Crime_Name: Pre-removal risk assessment refusal under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Eligibility for stay based on risk upon return to home country
Crimes.Application_Facts: Claims of personal risk from assailants, family separation, inadequate healthcare
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: PRRA refusal confirmed; stay motion dismissed
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Stay of removal based on risk and humanitarian grounds
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Stay denied due to failure to meet legal thresholds
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Rejected refugee with multiple failed protection claims
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Removal order enforced after PRRA denial
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution, violence, lack of medical access in Peru
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Serious question, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Credibility of risk claims and availability of state protection
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA, particularly Section 48 and PRRA provisions
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of PRRA outcome and request for interim relief
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness for PRRA, three-part test for stay
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Claims viewed as speculative and inconsistent with country conditions
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Prior decisions, country reports, personal affidavits
Crimes.Application_Basis: Alleged risk to life or safety upon return
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Previous assessments found no substantial risk
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Cancellation of removal order based on risk
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Three-part test for stay; PRRA eligibility criteria
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of new, compelling evidence of risk
Crimes.Outcome: Stay denied; removal order remains valid
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Alleged risks not established as likely or severe
Crimes.Cause_Description: Refugee claim rejected; H&C and PRRA applications denied
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Existing record reviewed; no new evidence accepted
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA provisions on removal and risk assessment
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Failure to present fresh, credible evidence
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal jurisdiction over immigration and refugee matters
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Negative – claims not supported by sufficient proof
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No serious question of success; no irreparable harm shown; public interest supports removal
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Generic allegations without specific corroborating evidence
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Serious question, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
